subject: Travel
title: Japanese Omiyage Souvenirs
description: A 60-second lesson on Japanese Omiyage Souvenirs.

hook.text: In Japan, returning from a trip without souvenirs for coworkers is a social offense.

buildup.text: Omiyage are edible regional gifts, usually beautifully packaged sweets from wherever you traveled.

discovery.text: Every train station and airport sells local omiyage. It's a billion-dollar industry in Japan.

twist.text: The wrapping matters as much as the contents. Tearing open a package carelessly is considered rude.

climax.text: Some travelers spend more on omiyage than on their own vacation meals.

punchline.text: In Japan, your trip isn't complete until you've fed the office.

quiz.question: What is omiyage in Japanese culture?
